info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 3:58PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 358 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Slide Rock State Park, or near Sedona, moving northeast at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Sedona, Slide Rock State Park, East Pocket Lookout Tower, Munds Park, Munds Mountain Wilderness, Indian Gardens, Uptown Sedona, West Fork of Oak Creek and Red Rock-Secret Mountain Wilderness.
This includes the following highways... State Route 179 near mile marker 313. State Route 89A between mile markers 374 and 385.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Manzanita Campground.
This includes the following swimming holes... Slide Rock, Encinoso, Grasshopper Point and Midgely Bridge.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT AREAS WITHIN OAK CREEK CANYON UNTIL 430 PM MST

area.areaDesc: Western Mogollon Rim; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons
